JavaScriptReferenceOperatorsImport.summary: The import() syntax, commonly called dynamic import, is a function-like expression that allows loading an ECMAScript module asynchronously and dynamically into a potentially non-module environment.

remarks.para: Unlike the declaration-style counterpart, dynamic imports are only evaluated when needed, and permit greater syntactic flexibility.

JavaScriptReferenceOperatorsImport.returns: Returns a promise which fulfills to a module namespace object: an object containing all exports from moduleName.The evaluation of import() never synchronously throws an error. moduleName is coerced to a string, and if coercion throws, the promise is rejected with the thrown error.
